question_text: A 45-year-old woman has chronic plaque psoriasis. She recently completed a glucocorticoid burst to treat an asthma exacerbation and subsequently developed the new generalized skin findings shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: Generalized pustular psoriasis (Option B) is most commonly recognized as creamy white pustules on an erythematous base that coalesce to form lakes of pus. These lesions may rupture, leaving large, eroded areas. This condition can be life threatening and frequently occurs following withdrawal of systemic glucocorticoids prescribed for another indication in a patient with psoriasis.
